content.body: I have a question about showing the code to the user without it running in the background

> For the purposes of interaction with other algorithms, an entryâ€™s filename is the empty string if value is not a `File` object, and otherwise its filename is the value of entryâ€™s valueâ€™s name attribute.
content.formatted_body: For the purposes of interaction with other algorithms, an entryâ€™s filename is the empty string if value is not a File object, and otherwise its filename is the value of entryâ€™s valueâ€™s name attribute.

content.body: Does anyone know if any spec uses this? Because XHR doesn't seem to
Andreu Botella (he/they): URL I think for application/x-www... and maybe multipart/form-data needs it?
content.formatted_body: Andreu Botella (he/they): URL I think for application/x-www... and maybe multipart/form-data needs it?

content.body: They might have used it before, but they don't anymore
The filename normalization now happens here: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#converting-an-entry-list-to-a-list-of-name-value-pairs
Right, I was about to say someone(tm) might have refactored that
I suspect that means we can clean that up, which is nice because it was always rather ugly
I was working on a patch to fix the USV handling in WebKit, and I realized that the way I'm doing things might be easier to sell if entry names and values are defined as USV strings
so I'm working on that now
